Episodes.Title: Too Many Cooks
Episodes.Writer: Dennis Koenig, Dan Wilcox, Thad Mumford
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: The 4077 receives a patient who is a bumbler at the front but regular gourmet in the mess tent. The surgical staff try and convince Potter to keep him but he flatly refuses. He has enough trouble as it is, his marriage is in danger.

Episodes.Title: Are You Now, Margaret?
Episodes.Writer: Thad Mumford, Dan Wilcox, Larry Gelbart
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: A visiting Congressional aide accuses Margaret of being a Communist sympathizer and it could ruin her career. This dovetails with Klinger entering the Stars & Stripes photo contest.

Episodes.Title: Guerilla My Dreams
Episodes.Writer: Bob Colleary, Dan Wilcox, Thad Mumford
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye refuses to accept a South Korean officer's warning that a wounded civilian he brought in is a dangerous enemy guerrilla soldier. Charles finds a new chess opponent.

Episodes.Title: Good-Bye Radar: Part 1
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Dan Wilcox
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: As Radar returns from leave, the camp struggles with a total loss of electricity due to a malfunctioning generator and a stolen backup.

Episodes.Title: Good-Bye Radar: Part 2
Episodes.Writer: Ken Levine, David Isaacs, Dan Wilcox
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Although Radar is granted a hardship discharge, the camp's difficulties make him seriously consider staying. Klinger begins taking over the company clerk job.

Episodes.Title: Period of Adjustment
Episodes.Writer: Jim Mulligan, John Rappaport, Dan Wilcox
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: B.J. and Klinger get drunk in despair at being envious of the now departed Radar.

Episodes.Title: Nurse Doctor
Episodes.Writer: Sy Rosen, Thad Mumford, Dan Wilcox
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: The senior staff's attempt to help a nurse enter medical school to become a doctor is complicated by her unwanted romantic advances towards Father Mulcahy. Only Charles is unaffected by a drought and water shortage.

Episodes.Title: Private Finance
Episodes.Writer: Dennis Koenig, Dan Wilcox, Thad Mumford
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Pierce deals with a dead soldier's ill-gotten gains, while a Korean mama attacks Klinger for dishonoring her daughter.

Episodes.Title: Mr. and Mrs. Who?
Episodes.Writer: Ronny Graham, Dan Wilcox, Thad Mumford
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: After a drunken trip to Tokyo, Winchester is visited by his new wife. Meanwhile, the camp is hit with an outbreak of hemorrhagic fever that they don't know how to deal with.

Episodes.Title: The Yalu Brick Road
Episodes.Writer: Mike Farrell, Dan Wilcox, Thad Mumford
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye and BJ get lost in enemy territory while Klinger's Thanksgiving turkey sickens most of the camp with salmonella.

Episodes.Title: Life Time
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Walter D. Dishell, Dan Wilcox
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: When one soldier, George, needs an aorta within 20 minutes to avoid paralysis and another soldier, Harold, arrives brain dead but with a beating heart, BJ must decide if he should remove Harold's aorta to save George's life.

Episodes.Title: Dear Uncle Abdul
Episodes.Writer: John Rappaport, Jim Mulligan, Dan Wilcox
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Resigned to staying for his term of service, Klinger writes home about his job, which includes appeasing the officers' eccentricities. A home-bound patient says goodbye to the slow-witted buddy who saved his life in battle.

Episodes.Title: Captain's Outrageous
Episodes.Writer: Thad Mumford, Dan Wilcox, Dennis Koenig
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: While the 4077th staff substitute for Rosie after she's injured in a brawl at her bar, Father Mulcahy is at the end of his patience when he is passed over for promotion yet again.

Episodes.Title: Stars and Stripes
Episodes.Writer: Dennis Koenig, Dan Wilcox, Thad Mumford
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: During a lull in casualties, friction occurs when Charles and B.J. try to write an article for a prestigious journal on a procedure they'd performed. Margaret discovers more about herself through a visit from Scully.

Episodes.Title: Yessir, That's Our Baby
Episodes.Writer: Jim Mulligan, Dan Wilcox, Thad Mumford
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: When the 4077th staff find an abandoned Amerasian baby, their efforts to help her prove a frustrating struggle.

Episodes.Title: Bottle Fatigue
Episodes.Writer: Thad Mumford, Dan Wilcox, Dennis Koenig
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Hawkeye goes on the wagon and drives everyone crazy. When Winchester hears that his sister is going to marry an Italian, he goes nuts, doing everything in his power to stop the marriage.

Episodes.Title: Heal Thyself
Episodes.Writer: Dennis Koenig, Gene Reynolds, Dan Wilcox
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: When Potter and Charles are quarantined with mumps and get on each others' nerves, a replacement surgeon from Tokyo is brought in.

Episodes.Title: Old Soldiers
Episodes.Writer: Dennis Koenig, Dan Wilcox, Thad Mumford
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: When Potter visits a sick friend in Tokyo, Hawkeye is in charge and the 4077th treats a group of refugee orphans.

Episodes.Title: Morale Victory
Episodes.Writer: John Rappaport, Dan Wilcox, Thad Mumford
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: While Hawkeye and BJ struggle as morale officers of the disgruntled camp, Winchester tries to help a patient whose pianist career seems ruined due to a crippled hand.

Episodes.Title: Lend a Hand
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, Jim Mulligan, John Rappaport
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Everyone at the 4077 is so cranky, cold and bored, BJ decides the only way to uplift spirits is to "borrow" Hawkeye's birthday. Hawkeye is not amused. Captain Anthony Borelli (Robert Alda) visits the 4077 to lecture about peripher...

Episodes.Title: Goodbye, Cruel World
Episodes.Writer: Thad Mumford, Dan Wilcox, Dennis Koenig
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: When Klinger's attempt to redecorate his office is rejected, he decides to desert while Hawkeye has a homebound war hero patient who attempts suicide.

Episodes.Title: Dreams
Episodes.Writer: Alan Alda, James Jay Rubinfier, Dan Wilcox
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: During a hectic non-stop rush of wounded that is overcrowding the camp, the staff's brief naps have disturbing dreams in which the war is an never-ending intrusion.

Episodes.Title: War Co-Respondent
Episodes.Writer: Mike Farrell, Dan Wilcox, Thad Mumford
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: B.J. feels torn when he and visiting war correspondent Aggie O'Shea fall for each other.

Episodes.Title: Back Pay
Episodes.Writer: Thad Mumford, Dan Wilcox, Dennis Koenig
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Pierce is upset by the fact that civilian doctors are making a lot of money off the war, and decides to bill the army for all his work. Meanwhile, Winchester is reluctantly showing 3 Korean doctors American medical techniques, put...

Episodes.Title: April Fools
Episodes.Writer: Dennis Koenig, Dan Wilcox, Thad Mumford
Episodes.Actors: Alan Alda, Mike Farrell, Harry Morgan
Episodes.Plot: Spit and polish Colonel Tucker visits the camp at the worst time during April Fool's Day. Klinger, egged on by Sergeant Rizzo, uses reverse psychology to try to get out of the Army.
